comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Oct 11, 1900 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50913F93C5B11738... indicates that a Francis B Delehanty was "named for the City Court bench." NYT of Dec 30, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0D1EF73F5C13738... notes his appointment to the Supreme Court of New York County. NYT of Dec 22, 1922 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0D16F9345411738... reports that Justice Francis B. Delehanty attended a dinner honoring New York Supreme Court Justice Samuel Greenbaum.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: New-York tribune., August 31, 1915, page 1 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-08-31/ed-... lists him on a campaign ticket -- "For Justices of the Supreme Court John Proctor Clarke, Samuel Greenbaum, Francis B. Delehanty, Clarence J. Shearn and Edward K. Pinch, to succeed themselves." The sun., October 10, 1915, FOURTH SECTION PICTORIAL MAGAZINE, Image 37 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-10-10/ed-... includes him in a group of pictures of the same group, described as "fusion candidates for the supreme court bench." The caption here reads Francis A. Delehanty, but looks to be the same guy, although without glasses.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq:  It does look likely it's Francis B. Delehanty.  We'll include his full name in the description next time we update.  Thanks.
